questions.text: A 22 yr old primigravida with ten weeks of gestation presents for MTP due to conception due to the failure of contraception. She has regular cycles and no comorbidities. On examination, P-90/min, saturation normal, afebrile, BP-120/82mmHg, RR-13/min, pallor +. MTP was done using the instrument shown below. The advantages of this procedure are all except- Ideal for termination for therapeutic indications Blood loss is minimal Chance of uterine perforation is less Suitable for bigger size uterus of > 10 weeks Select the correct answer from the code given below.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Only 4 SUCTION EVACUATION and CURETTAGE: This improvised method consists of a suction machine fitted with a cannula, either plastic (Karman) or metal, available in various sizes. The details of its technique are described in the chapter on operative obstetrics. Advantages: (1) It is done as an outdoor (2) Hazards of general anesthesia are absent as it is done, at best, under paracervical block anesthesia. (3) Ideal for termination for therapeutic indications. (4) Blood loss is minimal . (5) The chance of uterine perforation is much less , especially with the plastic cannula. Drawbacks: (1) The method is unsuitable for a bigger uterus of more than ten weeks as the chance of retained products increases . (2) Requires electricity to operate, and the machine is costly

questions.text: A couple married for 1yr now present to the OBG Opd for termination of pregnancy as conception occurred due to failure of contraception. The couple is planning to have offspring after 2- 3 yrs. On taking history, the LMP was 12 weeks ago. She has no comorbidities and regular cycles. General examination includes- P-90/min, BP-126/84mmHg, afebrile, saturation normal, RR-12/min. UPT was positive. The indications for MTP could be – Teratogenic drugs deform the fetus Social indications Cardiac disease grade III in mother Malignant hypertension Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above The given clinical scenario is that of Medical Termination of pregnancy (MTP) In practice, the following are the indications for termination under the MTP Act: To save the life of the mother (Therapeutic or Medical termination ): The indications are limited and scarcely justifiable nowadays except in the following cases: (i) Cardiac diseases ( Grade III and IV ) with a history of decompensation in the previous pregnancy or between the pregnancies. (ii) Chronic glomerulonephritis. (iii) Malignant hypertension . (iv) Intractable hyperemesis gravidarum. (v) Cervical or breast malignancy . (vi) Diabetes mellitus with retinopathy . (vii) Epilepsy or psychiatric illness with the advice of a psychiatrist. Social indications : This is almost the sole indication and is covered under the provision “to prevent grave injury to the physical and mental health of the pregnant woman.” In about 80 Percent, it is limited to parous women having unplanned pregnancies with low socioeconomic status . Pregnancy caused by rape or unwanted pregnancy caused due to failure of any contraceptive device also falls in this category (20 Percent). Eugenic : This is done under “ substantial risk of the child being born with serious physical and mental abnormalities so as to be handicapped.” The indication is rare. Structural ( Anencephaly ), chromosomal( Down’s syndrome) or genetic ( Haemophilia ) abnormalities of the fetus. ii. When the fetus is likely to be deformed due to the action of teratogenic drugs ( warfarin ) or radiation exposure ( > 10 rad) in early pregnancy. iii. Rubella , a viral infection affecting in the first trimester, is an indication for termination Hence all of the above is the answer.
